Detailed Description

Provides specific methods for operations on Variable Table for MySQL Database.

Definition at line 37 of file MySQLTableVariable.php.

Member Function Documentation

MySQLTableVariable::IdVariableExists (  $  idVariable  ) 
 

Checks whether the Variable of id $idVariable exists or not.

Parameters:
$idVariable The TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_IDVARIABLE of the variable to be checked.
Returns:
- true if variable exists

- false otherwise

Implements TableVariableInterface.

MySQLTableVariable::InsertVariable (  Variable $  variable  ) 
 

Inserts the given Variable $variable into the table.

Parameters:
$variable The Variable to be inserted
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of Error-s see BDDConnection::Query

Referenced by SaveVariables().

MySQLTableVariable::SaveVariables (  Variables $  variables  ) 
 

Updates validated items in $variables in function of its idVariable. If idVariable doesn't exist, item is inserted. If an item of $variables hasn't been validate, it is skipped.

Parameters:
$variables a Variables of items to be updated/inserted
Returns:
- NULL in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableVariableInterface.

Definition at line 43 of file MySQLTableVariable.php.

References IdVariableExists(), InsertVariable(), and TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_IDVARIABLE.

MySQLTableVariable::SelectServerVariables (   ) 
 

Selects all the Variable-s from Table which scope is Server.

Returns:
- a list of Variable-s in a Variables object in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableVariableInterface.

Definition at line 81 of file MySQLTableVariable.php.

MySQLTableVariable::SelectSiteVariables (  $  idSite  ) 
 

Selects all the Variable-s from Table which is Site and refers to site of id $idSites.

Parameters:
$idSite The id of the Site the variable-s returned refers to.
Returns:
- a list of Variable-s in a Variabless object in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableVariableInterface.

MySQLTableVariable::SelectVariablesByName (  $  varName  ) 
 

Selects the Group-s from table which TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $varName.

Parameters:
$varName the name of the Variable to select. It can contain magic chars like MYSQL_SEEK_MULTICHARS and MYSQL_SEEK_MULTICHARS. Please refer to your database documentation.
Returns:
- a Variables object : the Variable-s which TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $varName in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableVariableInterface.

Definition at line 136 of file MySQLTableVariable.php.

References MySQLTable::Select(), MySQLTable::TABLE_COLUMN_ALL, and TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME.

MySQLTableVariable::UpdateVariableByIdVariable (  Variable $  updatedVariable  ) 
 

Tries to update the given Variable $updatedVariable in function of its property TableVariable::TABLE_COLUMN_IDVARIABLE.

Parameters:
$updatedVariable The Variable to be updated
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of Error-s see BDDConnection::Query

Implements TableVariableInterface.
